entry.title: Kuz-Ram and other models for fragmentation estimation in blasting
entry.content:
The Kuz-Ram fragmentation model was developed in the early 1980s by A. Kuznetsov and C. Ramstrom. It is a semi-empirical model used to predict the rock fragmentation size distribution resulting from drilling and blasting operations in mining, quarrying, and construction.

The main premise of the model is that the size distribution of fragmented rock is determined by a combination of blasthole parameters (such as diameter, burden, and spacing), explosive energy, and the rockâ€™s inherent properties (e.g., its strength and structure).

The Kuz-Ram model uses the following equation to estimate the mean fragment size (ğ‘¥Ì…):

ğ‘¥Ì… = ğ´ * (ğ‘… * ğ¸)^(1/6) * ğ‘^(5/6) * ğ‘ ^(1/3)

Where:

  • ğ‘¥Ì… is the mean fragment size
  • ğ´ is a constant that depends on the rock properties and blast design parameters
  • ğ‘… is the rock factor, which accounts for the influence of rock properties on fragmentation
  • ğ¸ is the specific charge (the amount of explosive energy per unit volume of rock)
  • ğ‘ is the burden (the distance between the blasthole and the free face of the rock)
  • ğ‘  is the spacing (the distance between blastholes)

I draft a calculation tool here for you to calculate the Kuz Ram x50 and other 2 models easily.

The Kuz-Ram modelÂ is widely used in theÂ mining industryÂ for blast design and fragmentation prediction. However, it has its limitations and relies onÂ empirical relationships, which may not always hold true for complex geological and blasting conditions. Therefore, it is essential to validate the model with actual field data and adjust the parameters accordingly to improve the accuracy of predictions.

Disclaimer
All tools and knowledge presented on this website stem from my experiences and education at UNIVERSIDAD POLITÃ‰CNICA DE MADRID. I am deeply grateful to my professors, Jose Sanchidrian and Pablo Segarra, for their immense support and guidance throughout my academic journey. With this website, I have compiled the knowledge I gained into tools to share with others, hoping to positively impact their lives.

Please note that the information and tools provided on this website are for reference purposes only. While I have made every effort to ensure accuracy, there may still be errors. Exercise caution when applying this knowledge and these tools, and adjust them based on your specific circumstances.

entry.title: Blasting Engineering and share some books
entry.content:
Blasting engineering is a specialized field that primarily contributes to the following areas:

  1. Mining and Quarrying: Blasting engineering plays a crucial role in the extraction of minerals, ores, and other valuable resources from the earth. It involves designing and implementing controlled explosions to fragment and loosen rocks, making them easier to remove.

In the field of mining and quarrying, blasting engineering plays a crucial role in several aspects:

a. Fragmentation: Blasting engineers design and implement controlled explosions to fragment rocks in mines and quarries. By breaking large rocks into smaller, more manageable pieces, blasting helps facilitate the extraction of valuable minerals or materials. Proper fragmentation is important for efficient mining operations and subsequent processing.

b. Ore Extraction: Blasting is employed to loosen and dislodge rocks containing ores or minerals from the surrounding rock mass. This allows for easier extraction and transportation of the desired materials. Blasting engineers assess the rock characteristics, design blast patterns, and determine the optimal timing and sequence of blasts to maximize ore recovery.

c. Safety: Blasting engineers prioritize safety in mining and quarrying operations. They conduct extensive risk assessments, considering factors such as the proximity of workers, equipment, and neighboring communities. They develop blast designs that minimize the potential for flyrock, ground vibration, and air overpressure, ensuring the safety of personnel and nearby structures.

d. Environmental Impact: Blasting engineers also take environmental considerations into account. They design blasts to minimize the generation of dust, control noise levels, and mitigate any potential adverse effects on water bodies or ecosystems. Proper blast design and monitoring help reduce the environmental footprint of mining and quarrying activities.

e. Blasting Optimization: Blasting engineers continuously strive to optimize blasting techniques to improve efficiency and productivity in mining and quarrying operations. They use advanced technologies, such as computer modeling and simulations, to optimize blast designs, reduce energy consumption, and minimize the overall costs associated with drilling, explosives, and downstream processes.

f. Slope Stability: In open-pit mining operations, blasting engineers play a role in assessing and managing slope stability. They evaluate the rock mass conditions and design controlled blasts to minimize the risk of slope failures, ensuring the safety of workers and equipment working in the vicinity of steep walls or benches.

Overall, blasting engineering is an integral part of mining and quarrying operations, contributing to efficient and safe extraction of minerals, environmental stewardship, and the optimization of mining processes.

  1. Construction: Blasting is commonly used in construction projects to excavate rock or remove obstacles such as boulders. Blasting engineers assess the geological conditions and develop strategies to safely break or fragment rocks to facilitate construction activities.
  2. Demolition: Blasting engineers are involved in controlled demolition projects, where they use explosives to bring down buildings, bridges, or other structures safely and efficiently. They employ their expertise to ensure the controlled collapse of structures while minimizing damage to the surroundings.
  3. Civil Engineering: In civil engineering projects, blasting engineering is utilized for various purposes such as tunneling, road construction, and foundation excavation. Blasting techniques are employed to create tunnels, cut through mountains, or remove hard rock formations, enabling the construction of infrastructure projects.

I personally have been working for underground projects in Africa, Europe for 5 years, attending 3 projects, including open cut draft blasting, knowing vertical drop system and also up/down holes blasting design.

For sharing, I list the few books I have read and collected,

Modern Trends in Tunneling and Blast Design (John Johansen, C.F. Mathiesen)

Rock Fracture and Blasting. Theory and Applications Zongxian Zhang

Underground Mining Methods - Engineering Fundamentals and International Case Studies by William A. Hustrulid, Richard L. Bullock

Handbook of Tunnel Engineering (Volume I_ Structures and Methods) __ Drill and Blast Tunneling

Blasting Technology for Underground Hard Rock Mining-Springer (2023)

For copywrite issue, I canâ€™t share books which are not published in public for free use.

  1. Geotechnical Engineering: Blasting engineering contributes to geotechnical engineering by providing methods to stabilize rock slopes and prevent landslides. Controlled blasting can be used to modify the slopeâ€™s stability or remove unstable rock masses, enhancing the safety of infrastructure in hilly or mountainous regions.
  2. Oil and Gas Industry: Blasting engineering techniques are applied in the oil and gas industry for well stimulation, commonly known as hydraulic fracturing or â€œfracking.â€ Blasting helps create fractures in the rock formations, allowing for the extraction of oil and gas from deep underground.
  3. Military and Defense: Blasting engineering has military applications, particularly in areas such as demolition, explosives disposal, and explosive ordnance disposal (EOD). Blasting engineers are involved in the safe handling, utilization, and disposal of explosive materials used in defense operations.

Indeed, working as a blaster can be challenging and requires a certain skill set and knowledge base. Here are some reasons why the job can be difficult:

  1. Technical Expertise: Blasters need to possess a deep understanding of explosives, including their properties, behavior, and safe handling. They must have knowledge of various blasting techniques, equipment, and tools used in the field. This expertise is crucial to design effective blast patterns, calculate the proper amount of explosives, and ensure the desired results while maintaining safety.
  2. Safety Considerations: Blasting is inherently hazardous, and safety is paramount in this line of work. Blasters must adhere to strict safety protocols and regulations to protect themselves, their colleagues, and the surrounding environment. They must constantly assess risks, handle explosives with extreme care, and take precautions to prevent accidents, such as flyrock, ground vibrations, or misfires.
  3. Physical Demands: The job of a blaster involves physically demanding work. They often work outdoors in various weather conditions, requiring stamina and resilience. Blasters may need to carry heavy equipment, climb steep slopes or structures, and perform physically strenuous tasks while ensuring accuracy and precision in their work.
  4. Environmental Factors: Blasters must consider and minimize the potential impact of their work on the environment. They need to manage dust control, noise levels, and prevent any harm to nearby water bodies or ecosystems. This requires a strong understanding of environmental regulations and best practices to mitigate any adverse effects.
  5. Stress and Responsibility: Blasters carry a significant responsibility for the safety and success of their blasting operations. They must make critical decisions regarding blast design, timing, and execution, often under tight deadlines and within budget constraints. The pressure to deliver results while ensuring safety can create a high-stress work environment.
  6. Continuous Learning and Adaptation: The field of blasting engineering is constantly evolving, with new technologies, techniques, and safety measures being introduced. Blasters must stay updated with the latest advancements, regulations, and industry practices to maintain their expertise and adapt to changing requirements.

It is important to note that proper training, experience, and adherence to safety protocols are essential for blasters to carry out their work effectively and safely.

Blasting engineering is a specialized field that primarily contributes to the following areas:

entry.title: Demystifying the p-value
entry.content:
Table of Contents

  1. Introduction to p-value
  2. The Null Hypothesis and the Alternative Hypothesis
  3. Calculating the p-value
  4. Interpreting the p-value
  5. Examples of p-value in real-life situations
  6. Conclusion

1. Introduction to p-value

The p-value, or probability value, is a concept used in hypothesis testing and is a fundamental aspect of statistical analysis. It is a measure of the probability that an observed effect in a dataset occurred by chance alone. In other words, the p-value gives us an idea of how likely it is that we would observe the data we have if there were no real underlying effect.

In this blog post, we will break down the concept of the p-value, explain how itâ€™s calculated, and provide examples to help you better understand and interpret p-values in your own research.

2. The Null Hypothesis and the Alternative Hypothesis

Before we dive into p-values, itâ€™s important to understand the concept of hypothesis testing. In a hypothesis test, two opposing hypotheses are presented:

  1. Null Hypothesis (H0): This hypothesis states that there is no significant difference between the observed effect and the expected effect. In other words, any effect observed in the data is due to random chance.
  2. Alternative Hypothesis (H1): This hypothesis states that there is a significant difference between the observed effect and the expected effect. In other words, the effect observed in the data is not due to random chance, but rather due to an underlying cause.

Our goal in hypothesis testing is to determine whether we should accept or reject the null hypothesis based on the data we have collected.

3. Calculating the p-value

The p-value is the probability of observing a test statistic as extreme or more extreme than the one calculated from our data, assuming that the null hypothesis is true. To calculate the p-value, we follow these steps:

  1. Assume that the null hypothesis is true.
  2. Calculate the test statistic from the data.
  3. Determine the probability of observing a test statistic as extreme or more extreme than the calculated test statistic, assuming the null hypothesis is true. This probability is the p-value.

In general, the formula for calculating the p-value is:

p-value = P(T > t | H0)

where T is the test statistic, t is the observed value of the test statistic, and H0 is the null hypothesis.

4. Interpreting the p-value

After calculating the p-value, we compare it to a predetermined significance level (Î±), which is usually set at 0.05. The significance level represents the probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when itâ€™s true.

  • If the p-value is less than or equal to Î± (p â‰¤ Î±), we reject the null hypothesis and accept the alternative hypothesis. In this case, we consider the observed effect to be statistically significant.
  • If the p-value is greater than Î± (p > Î±), we fail to reject the null hypothesis. In this case, we consider the observed effect to be statistically insignificant and attribute it to random chance.

5. Examples of p-value in real-life situations

Example 1: Testing a new drug

A pharmaceutical company wants to test the effectiveness of a new drug designed to lower blood pressure. They set up a clinical trial with a control group and a treatment group. The null hypothesis is that the drug has no significant effect on blood pressure, while the alternative hypothesis is that the drug does have a significant effect.

After the trial, the researchers calculate a p-value of 0.03. Since the p-value is less than the significance level of 0.05, they reject the null hypothesis and conclude that the drug has a significant effect on blood pressure.

Example 2: Examining the relationship between two variables

A researcher is studying the relationship between hours spent studying and test scores. The null hypothesis is that there is no significant relationship between the two variables, while the alternative hypothesis is that there is a significant relationship.

After analyzing the data, the researcher calculates a p-value of 0.08. Since the p-value is greater than the significance level of 0.05, they fail to reject the null hypothesis and conclude that there is no significant relationship between hours spent studying and test scores.

6. Conclusion

The p-value is a crucial concept in hypothesis testing and statistical analysis. It allows us to determine whether an observed effect ina dataset is likely due to random chance or an underlying cause. By comparing the p-value to a predetermined significance level, we can decide whether to reject or fail to reject the null hypothesis, which ultimately helps us make informed decisions based on our data.

Itâ€™s essential to remember that a low p-value does not prove that the null hypothesis is false. It only indicates that, given the data, the observed effect is unlikely to have occurred by chance alone. Additionally, a high p-value does not prove that the null hypothesis is true. It simply suggests that the data does not provide sufficient evidence to reject it. As researchers, we must always consider the context and limitations of our studies when interpreting p-values and drawing conclusions.

entry.title: Career development opportunities
entry.content:
I would like to share some engineering job positions that have been listed on the official website of the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE). These positions primarily exist in European and American countries. It is important to note that the entry requirements for these positions are quite rigorous; however, I am sharing these opportunities with everyone to provide visibility to such prospects. As of now, I have gathered information on a total of 1500 job positions. Below, I have provided a selection of these positions.

In the future, I will continue to share more career opportunities on this platform. It is worth mentioning that all the information provided has been sourced directly from official channels. I have also included hyperlinks (blue-colored Chinese job titles) that allow you to access the official website and apply directly for these positions

For your interaction easily, I use power BI for the visulization

Since you have experienced the Power BI, I would like to share more with this essential data tool

Power BI is a powerful business intelligence tool developed by Microsoft that offers a range of features and capabilities for engineers. It allows engineers to analyze, visualize, and share data in a user-friendly and interactive manner. Hereâ€™s an introduction to Power BI and its benefits for engineers:

  1. Data Integration: Power BI allows engineers to connect and integrate data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, cloud services, and IoT devices. This enables engineers to gather and consolidate data from different systems into a single, unified view for analysis.

  2. Data Visualization: Power BI provides a wide array of interactive visualization options, including charts, graphs, maps, and custom visuals. Engineers can use these visual elements to present complex engineering data in a more understandable and meaningful way, enabling them to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies.

  3. Real-time Monitoring: Power BI offers real-time data monitoring capabilities, allowing engineers to track live data from sensors, equipment, or any other data source. This is particularly useful in engineering applications where real-time monitoring is crucial, such as industrial processes, manufacturing, or infrastructure management.

  4. Advanced Analytics: Power BI incorporates advanced analytics capabilities, including data modeling, data mining, and machine learning. Engineers can leverage these features to perform in-depth analysis, predictive modeling, and anomaly detection, enabling them to make data-driven decisions and identify potential issues or optimization opportunities.

  5. Collaboration and Sharing: Power BI facilitates collaboration among engineers by allowing them to share reports, dashboards, and datasets with colleagues or stakeholders. This promotes knowledge sharing, enhances decision-making processes, and fosters a collaborative environment for engineering teams.

  6. Mobile Access: Power BI offers mobile applications for iOS and Android devices, enabling engineers to access reports and dashboards on the go. This allows engineers to stay connected to critical data and make informed decisions even when they are away from their desks.

  7. Integration with Other Tools: Power BI seamlessly integrates with other Microsoft products such as Excel, Azure, and SharePoint. Engineers can leverage these integrations to leverage their existing data sources and workflows, making it easier to incorporate Power BI into their existing engineering processes.

In summary, Power BI is an excellent tool for engineers as it empowers them to analyze and visualize engineering data effectively, monitor real-time information, collaborate with colleagues, and make data-driven decisions. With its wide range of features and integrations, Power BI can enhance the productivity and efficiency of engineering teams across various industries.

entry.title: A Game Changer for Amazon Sellers' Revenue Analysis
entry.content:
Hey folks! As a former data analyst who worked with Amazon sellers, I have had the opportunity to help clients discover new product opportunities and optimize their listings. One tool that made a significant impact on my work back then was Power BI. In this blog post, I will share my personal experience with Power BI and some specific examples of how it helped me boost my clientsâ€™ revenue on Amazon, without making it sound like an advertisement.

Share first with you a example of what I did before in Power BI

The Power BI Turning Point

My journey with Power BI started when I was tasked with finding new product opportunities for one of my clients on Amazon. I had access to loads of data from various sources like sales history, customer reviews, and competitor listings, but I needed a way to make sense of it all. Thatâ€™s when I stumbled upon Power BI, and it turned out to be a game changer! It streamlined data cleaning and transformation, and allowed me to create interactive visualizations that provided valuable insights.

My Project: Amazon Product Opportunity Analysis for Clients

Let me dive deeper into my Amazon product opportunity analysis project and how Power BI contributed to its success.

Data Preparation

I began by connecting Power BI to various data sources like CSV files for sales history, an Excel spreadsheet for customer reviews, and a web scraping API for competitor listings. Using Power Query, I was able to merge these datasets, clean up missing values, and create calculated columns like average rating, sales rank, and revenue estimates.

Data Exploration

Once my data was clean, I explored it using Power BIâ€™s interactive visualizations. I used a scatter plot to find correlations between product attributes like price, rating, and sales rank. This helped me identify potential gaps in the market where my clients could introduce new products or optimize their listings.

I also created a tree map to visualize the distribution of sales across different product categories and subcategories. This allowed me to spot emerging trends and identify niche markets with high growth potential for my clients.

One of the features I found quite useful was the ability to create custom visuals using R or Python. I used the seaborn library in Python to create a heatmap of competitor pricing, which helped me understand pricing strategies and find opportunities for differentiation for my clients.

Sharing Insights

After I had uncovered some valuable product opportunities, I needed to share my findings with my clients. Power BI made this process incredibly easy! I published my report to the Power BI service and shared the link with them. They were able to interact with the visualizations and even filter the data based on specific product categories or attributes.

The Impact of Power BI on My Work as a Data Analyst

My experience with Power BI had a profound impact on my work as a data analyst for Amazon sellers. It made data analysis more accessible and efficient, allowing me to deliver valuable insights to my clients that helped them grow their businesses.

Keep in mind, you donâ€™t need to be a professional data scientist to leverage tools like Power BI. Even data analysts like myself can unlock the potential of data and turn it into valuable insights for their clients.

I hope my personal experience with Power BI and its impact on my Amazon product opportunity analysis project has been insightful for you. Feel free to share your thoughts and experiences with similar tools. Iâ€™m always eager to learn from fellow data analysts and enthusiasts. Happy analyzing!

    ï¼ˆ3ï¼‰å½“ a<0 æ—¶ï¼Œå¹‚å‡½æ•°çš„å›¾è±¡åœ¨åŒºé—´(0,+âˆ)ä¸Šæ˜¯å‡å‡½æ•°ï¼åœ¨ç¬¬ä¸€è±¡é™å†…ï¼Œ å½“ x ä»å³è¾¹è¶‹å‘åŸç‚¹æ—¶ï¼Œå›¾è±¡åœ¨ y è½´å³æ–¹æ— é™åœ°é€¼è¿‘ y è½´æ­£åŠè½´ï¼Œå½“ x è¶‹ äº+âˆæ—¶ï¼Œå›¾è±¡åœ¨è½´ x ä¸Šæ–¹æ— é™åœ°é€¼è¿‘è½´ x æ­£åŠè½´ã€‚ æŒ‡å‡ºï¼šæ­¤æ—¶ yï¼x0ï¼1ï¼›å®šä¹‰åŸŸä¸ºï¼ˆï¼âˆï¼Œ0ï¼‰âˆªï¼ˆ0ï¼Œï¼‹âˆï¼‰ï¼Œç‰¹åˆ«å¼ºè°ƒï¼Œ å½“ x ä¸ºä»»ä½•éé›¶å®æ•°æ—¶ï¼Œå‡½æ•°çš„å€¼å‡ä¸º 1ï¼Œå›¾åƒæ˜¯ä»ç‚¹ï¼ˆ0ï¼Œ1ï¼‰å‡ºå‘ï¼Œå¹³è¡Œäº x è½´çš„ä¸¤æ¡å°„çº¿ï¼Œä½†ç‚¹ï¼ˆ0ï¼Œ1ï¼‰è¦é™¤å¤–ã€‚

2.2 ç›¸å…³åº”ç”¨-é•¿å°¾åˆ†å¸ƒ

AÂ long tail distributionÂ has tails that taper off gradually rather than drop off sharply. They are a subset ofÂ heavy-tailed distributions.Â Itâ€™s easy to visualize the idea of a long tailed function, and slightly harder to make it concrete.

If we want to be rigorous, though, there is a exact mathematical definition of a long tailed function (Foss et. al, 2013):

(ultimately positive)Â functionÂ f is defined according to aÂ limitÂ â€”a term introduced inÂ calculus. Very basically, the limit tells you where the distribution converges to at a certain point. In this case, if theÂ ratioÂ of x + y and x converge to 1 as the x-values get much larger, then the distribution is long-tailed:

e long tailed property of distributions carries over into many derivative distributions.

If f1, f2â€¦ fnÂ are all long tailed, then:

Any distribution that can be expressed as a product of these, fx= f1Â Â· f2â€¦ Â· fnÂ is also long tailed.

Any distribution that can be expressed as a linear combination of these is long tailed. That means that any function

Commerce and marketing schemes often find that there sales can best be modeled by long tail distributions. For instance, an internet store may have certain items with very high sales (modeled by the center of the distribution curve) and a large number of items with much lower sales (modeled by the long tail).

Although the sales volume for every individual item in the tail may be negligible, there are enough items that they play a significant role in the general profit taking. In fact, the profit from low-sale volume items can rival or even sometimes leave in the dust the profit made from best-sellersâ€”provided only the tail is long enough.

2.3é•¿å°¾åˆ†å¸ƒåº”ç”¨åœ¨ç”µå•†å¹³å°

2.3.1 äºšé©¬é€Šå¹³å°

å¯¹äºå¤§éƒ¨åˆ†çš„è¡Œä¸šè½¯ä»¶ï¼Œå¦‚å–å®¶ç²¾çµï¼Œæ•°æ´¾ï¼ŒåŸºæœ¬ä¸Šæ˜¯æ ¹æ®åæ¯”ä¾‹å‡½æ•°ç»“åˆæœºå™¨å­¦ä¹ æ¥æ ¹æ®Bsr æ’åçš„æƒé‡æ¥åæ¨é”€é‡ã€‚

To people that donâ€™t understand them, they manifest as â€˜unfairnessâ€™, which they are. Unlike normal distributions, long tailed phenomena do not centre around a mid-point. Theyâ€™re totally unsymmetrical and extreme events are rare, unpredictable but have gargantuan impacts when they eventually occur.

There are two models that we can use to map-out how these long-tailed distributions occur.

Preferential attachment: Imagine a network consisting of nodes and connections between nodes. The more connected a node is, the more likely it is to receive new links [3].

Preferential attachment often plays out in social domains. Looking at Instagram as an example, if you think about accounts as nodes and followers as connections; the more followers an account has, the more likely it is to receive more followers. The distribution of followers across social media accounts is a likely long tailed.

Self-organized Criticality: Imagine an empty N by N grid. A random site on the grid is chosen, if empty the site grows a tree with a probability g. If a site contains a tree lightening hits the site with a probability of (1-g). The lightening struck tree catches fire and the fire spreads to all connected trees[1].

In plain English, most forest fires are small but there exists a point where the forest becomes so dense that a fire could be gigantic.

Hereâ€™s a cool simulation of self-organized criticality playing out in theÂ forest fire model.

Taking earthquakes as an example of a phenomenon that roughly follows a power law distribution with an exponent of 2[1].

An earthquake of magnitude 9 would be the size of the 2011 earthquake in Honshu Japan. It was estimated to have killed around 29,000 people and damaged nuclear reactors [5]. According to our assumptions about the distribution of earthquakes, an earthquake of this magnitude occurs with a probability of around one-in-a-million each day. Across 1 century this one in a million event has a probability of occurrence of around 3.5%.

Given the devastation that it could cause, suddenly this seems very concerning. It becomes even more so when you realise that the most earthquakes are between 5â€“5.9 on the Richter scale [6], a-thousand to ten-thousand times weaker than our one-in-a-million event.

Lack of awareness of long tailed phenomena will cause governments to be ill-prepared for these extreme events leading to mass destruction.

entry.title: First to Data Analyst
entry.content:
Data Analyst

For data analysis, I think the most important thing is to clarify the business goals, identify the gaps with the goals, and determine the problems that need to be solved.

Core Issue 1:Â Defining the problemÂ - Identifying the reasons for the gap (requires analytical ability andÂ business sense, both personally and on average for peers)

CoreÂ Issue 2:Â Cause analysisÂ - After finding possible reasons, refine the indicators

Core Issue 3:Â Analyzing indicatorsÂ - Find the necessary data to support the analysis (how to find it depends on how to utilize tools)

Core Issue 4:Â Data analysisÂ - Analysis methods

Core Issue 5:Â Solution testingÂ - Once the cause is hypothesized, how to judge if the assumption is correct and proceed with the experiment

Core Issue 6:Â Continuous improvementÂ - How to findÂ predictive indicatorsÂ to prevent similar problems from recurring and detect them early

For example, when analyzing the overspending of advertising budget:

First, you need to realize that the problem you are analyzing is overspending. Did you have a definition for overspending previously?

Then, what are the reasons?

  • Sales
  • Price
  • Conversion
  • Bidding
  • Increase in bidding

Overall increase? Local increase? factors? Market factors?

A particular department is having a problem; which product in the department?

How to prevent it?

Why do it?

What to do?

How to do it?

As forÂ SQL statements, such as:

  1. Execution order
  2. Table additions, deletions, and reductions, primary key PID
  3. Aggregate functions
  4. Date conversion
  5. Table joins
  6. Window functions
  7. Sliding window functions
  8. Row andÂ column transformations

In the era of GPT, is this really important?

entry.title: How do I think â€œReadingâ€
entry.content:
How do I think â€œReadingâ€

Concept

Before discussing a concept, letâ€™s first define its connotation, extension, and the boundaries of the discussion. My understanding of â€œreadingâ€ is: as a behavior, obtaining information through text-based media. This information may not have an effect on you.

  1. Text-based media
  2. Obtaining information
  3. Such information may have an impact

Example 1: A physics book will tell you the mechanical reasons for the movement of objects. If you start reading, there may be the following outcomes:

â€”You donâ€™t understand at all

In this case, you are just â€œlookingâ€ at the book, which is not reading. Even if you look at it for ten years, reading hasnâ€™t started yet.

â€”You understand, acquire knowledge of mechanics, and comprehend the principles of object movement

In this case, you are â€œreading.â€ Perhaps you can understand why high-speed cars have a long braking distance, and why bicycles donâ€™t fall over. Whether or not you can invent a product like a â€œbicycleâ€ is an unknown!

â€œTo read or not to readâ€

First, we need to rule out the â€œdonâ€™t understandâ€ problem because thatâ€™s not considered reading. Personally, I categorize reading into three types:

  1. Reading as input, outputting some unpredictable results through the brainâ€™s exploration.

    This is generally referred to as inspiring thinking. Your input may be controlled by others, such as educational reading clubs or recommendations from others. This is more like the popular AI language models.

    Pros: It may create a wonderful chemical reaction; perhaps youâ€™ll have an epiphany after reading.

    Cons: If the input is single or even controlled, the output will also be single, perhaps a form of â€œbrainwashing.â€

    Advice: If you are often passively required to read, you can explore different types or even completely opposite ones. For example, pairing mainstream books with â€œbanned books.â€

  2. Reading as a tool, flipping through books for a specific goal or problem, thus achieving a problem-solving result.

    This is a more practical method I use. You could say â€œevery book is beneficial,â€ but itâ€™s very utilitarian.

    Pros: Books offer a more systematic and accurate explanation of the problem. And it can solve the problem relatively quickly. Especially for broad issues, this method can help you enter the relevant field fastest.

    Cons: Poor timeliness, especially for cutting-edge problems. For some specific issues, forums may be more efficient.

    Advice: Stay sensitive and be sure to understand the background of the book first.

  3. Reading as a habit, similar to watching TV.

    I admire those who make reading a habit, especially for non-fiction books. The input of information is not a pleasant process. This type of â€œreadingâ€ might be driven by the dopamine rush from entertaining novel reading or the habit of reading by successful peopleâ€¦

    Advice: No advice, as I have little exposure to this.

In summary, if you:

  1. Donâ€™t expect yourself to have â€œoutput,â€ let alone transform yourself
  2. Donâ€™t have a problem that needs solving and donâ€™t like solving problems yourself

Then there is no need to read.

Suggestions

We all live in an environment where high-quality information is scarce. As a method of obtaining information, reading can be considered the most effective means.
